parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  While the advertiser, Marius Dulce, is identified as the mayor of Calarasi and president of the PSD in Calarasi, the post itself focuses on a municipal project unrelated to the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is presented to a wide audience, not just a select group of individuals. The use of hashtags further suggests an intention to reach a broader audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The post's objective is to inform the public about a municipal project involving the purchase of electric vehicles. There is no explicit or implicit attempt to influence votes for any candidate in the parliamentary elections. The content focuses on local governance and environmental initiatives.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of citizen journalism, aiming to inform the public about a local government initiative. It presents factual information about the project, its cost, and its intended use.  It does not contain biased opinions or calls to action related to the parliamentary elections.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express personal opinions unrelated to the project. The information presented is factual and related to the municipal project.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1727673068080776</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post describes a municipal project unrelated to the parliamentary elections.  While the advertiser is a member of a political party, the content itself focuses on the acquisition of electric vehicles for the municipality of Calarasi.  There is no mention of any parliamentary candidate, nor is there any attempt to influence voters in the parliamentary elections. The post fulfills the criteria of informative citizen journalism, providing factual information about a local government initiative.  Therefore, it does not constitute electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>PSD</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
